details.title: 82 per cent COVID-19 cases limited to 10 states, UTs: Health Ministry
details.content: "A total of 28 states and UTs are conducting more than 140 COVID-19 tests per day per million population. India is conducting 479 tests per day per million population for the detection of the disease," Union Health Secretary Rajesh Bhushan said.

details.title: As India braces for Ayodhya's Ram mandir 'bhoomi pujan' today, row erupts in Bengal over lockdown
details.content: Strict security measures in Bengal amid row over Wednesday's lockdown While security will be tight to enforce the lockdown to combat COVID-19, extra precautions will be taken to thwart any attempt to disrupt the law and situation "anywhere by anyone be it any political or non-political body," the official said hinting at the Ram Mandir bhumi pujan. (READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India reports 52,509 new cases, 857 fatalities; tally crosses 19-lakh mark
details.content:
India's #COVID19 tally crosses 19-lakh mark with single-day spike of 52,509 new cases & 857 deaths in the last 24 hours.

The total number of positive cases is 19,08,255 including 5,86,244 active cases, 12,82,216 cured/discharged/migrated & 39,795 deaths: Health Ministry pic.twitter.com/JbTtxwbD2y

details.title: Delhites beware: Seasonal influenza likely to pose hurdles as symptoms similar to that of COVID-19
details.content: With the arrival of monsoon in the national capital, there is likely to be an increase in seasonal influenzas such as fever, cough and cold and vector-borne diseases which several health experts fear might clash with curning the ongoing coronavirus pandemic as both tend to share similar symptoms. (READ HERE)

details.title: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan recovers from COVID-19, discharged from hospital
details.content:
Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan discharged from Bhopal's Chirayu Hospital after recovering from #COVID19.

He had tested positive for the disease on 25th July. The hospital has advised him to isolate himself at home and self monitor his health for a further 7 days. pic.twitter.com/quacfT4f3g

— ANI (@ANI) August 5, 2020

details.title: UP cabinet minister Brajesh Pathak tests positive for COVID-19
details.content:
"After symptoms of coronavirus, I got tested on the advice of doctors. I tested positive for COVID-19. Those who came in contact with me in past few days are requested to follow government guidelines and quarantine themselves and get themselves tested," Uttar Pradesh Law minister Pathak said in a tweet.

 

https://twitter.com/brajeshpathakup/status/1290840171064123392?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1290840171064123392%7Ctwgr%5E&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.newindianexpress.com%2Fnation%2F2020%2Faug%2F05%2Fup-cabinet-minister-brajesh-pathak-tests-positive-for-covid-19-2179365.html

details.title: UP cabinet minister Brajesh Pathak tests positive for COVID-19
details.content:
कोरोना के प्रारंभिक लक्षण लगने पर डॉक्टरों के परामर्श पर कराई गई कोविड-19की जाँच में मेरी रिपोर्ट positiveआयी है।अतःविगत दिनों मेरे संपर्क में आने वाले लोगों से अनुरोध है कि कृपया सरकार द्वारा निर्धारित कोविड-19की गाइडलाइंस के अनुसार स्वयं को क्वारंटाइन कर जाँच कराने का कष्ट करें

details.content: Bhubaneswar Municipal Corporation (BMC) on Tuesday issued an order asking tea and tiffin centers, juice stalls and the roadside food joints, vans and kiosks serving gupchup, chaat and dishes to stick to takeaways only.

details.title: Singer SP Balasubrahmanyam tests positive for COVID-19
details.content: In a video post, the legendary playback singer stated that his test results came positive and so hot himself admitted to a private hospital in Chennai. SPB revealed that he had fever, a cold and chest congestion and wanted to get tested for the coronavirus. Though doctors had suggested for home isolation, he decided to get admitted. (Video Screengrab)

details.title: JD(S) MLA from Karnataka dies after prolonged illness, tested negative for COVID-19
details.content:
A statement from Manipal Hospital, where the 69-year-old legislator was admitted for treatment, said that he was suffering for a long time from chronic liver disease.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Odisha's COVID-19 caseload crosses 39,000-mark; death toll mounts to 225
details.content:
Odisha's COVID-19 caseload crossed the 39,000-mark with the detection of 1,337 fresh infections, while nine more fatalities pushed its coronavirus death toll to 225 on Wednesday, a health official said. The fresh infections reported in 28 districts took the state's tally to 39,018, he said.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Rs 42 lakh loss as some Shramik Specials ran empty: Maharashtra govt to HC
details.content:
The Maharashtra government on Wednesday told the Bombay High Court that it incurred a loss of around Rs 42 lakh as most of the Shramik Special trains arranged in the last month to ferry stranded migrant workers to their native states amid the COVID-19 pandemic went empty.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.content:
A cruise ship with 123 passengers on board and a crew of 85 docked Wednesday in the Norwegian harbour of Bodoe but no one could disembark after a former passenger from Denmark tested positive for the coronavirus upon returning home.

details.title: Nightmare continues in Odisha with 1337 fresh cases, 11 deaths in 24 hours
details.content:
The infection tally climbed close to 40,000 after 1337 new cases were detected from 28 of the 30 districts. According to the Health and Family Welfare Department, the deceased included two women, aged 52 and 60 from Ganjam and Khurda respectively. Of the 11 deaths, nine persons, including five from Ganjam and one each from Sundargarh, Keonjhar, Gajapati and Khurda succumbed to novel coronavirus.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: 'At home' function for Independence Day cancelled in Jammu and Kashmir
details.content:
• The Jammu and Kashmir administration on Wednesday said the 'at home' function for this year's Independence Day at Raj Bhawan, Srinagar has been cancelled in view of the COVID-19 pandemic
  • 'In view of the COVID-19 pandemic, the 'At Home' function for this year's Independence Day to be hosted by the Raj Bhavan, Srinagar, as per past practice, stands cancelled," a Raj Bhawan spokesperson said
  • The spokesperson said the decision was taken after assessing the current circumstances of the pandemic in the union territory and keeping in view the compliance of all healthcare protocols and SOP's notified by the central and the UT governments

(Inputs from PTI)

details.title: Kerala: Entrance exams cancelled in wake of coronavirus
details.content:
NEWS ALERT: Entrance exam for admission to #MCA courses in AICTE-recognised educational institutions in #Kerala for 2020-21 cancelled in the wake of #Covid19. Rank list will be prepared on the basis of marks scored in qualifying examination. @xpresskerala @NewIndianXpress

— Sovi Vidyadharan (@sovividyadharan) August 5, 2020

details.title: Over six-lakh tests conducted in India for second straight day: Centre
details.content: India has continued testing over 6 lakh COVID-19 samples for the second consecutive day. With 6,19,652 tests conducted in the last 24 hours, the cumulative testing as on date has reached 2,14,84,402. The tests per million has seen a sharp increase to 15568: Union Health Ministry

details.title: Former Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah stable, says hospital
details.content:
Former Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah, who is undergoing treatment for coronavirus, is now stable and has no fever, the hospital where he is admitted said on Wednesday. Siddaramaiah was admitted on Monday night after having fever in the morning, according to his son Dr Yathindra Siddaramaiah.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Global update | Third of Afghans estimated to have contracted virus: Health Ministry
details.content:
The survey estimated that 31.5 per cent of the population had contracted the virus, with the highest infection rate in Kabul where more than half of the city's five million population were thought to have been infected. But the country of around 32 million people has only limited testing capacity and has officially declared just 36,000 cases and more than 1,200 deaths.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Dharavi reports one new COVID-19 case
details.content: One COVID-19 positive case has been reported in Dharavi area of Mumbai today, taking the total number of cases to 2589 including 77 active cases and 2254 discharges: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation

details.title: Ailing Lalu shifted to RIMS director’s bungalow to keep Covid-19 away
details.content:
Jailed RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav, currently admitted to Rajendra Institute of Medical Sciences (RIMS) in Ranchi, was shifted to the official residence of RIMS director, also known as Kelly Bungalow located inside the hospital campus.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: Bengaluru: First-of-its-kind mobile COVID-19 lab dedicated to public
details.content:
Touted as a first of its kind in the nation, a mobile COVID-19 lab was inaugurated on Wednesday by the Karnataka Medical Education Minister Dr K Sudhakar
The lab, approved by the (ICMR can do 9,000 RT-PCR (reverse transcription polymerase chain reaction) tests per month, an official press release
'This is a unique lab having all safety features and capable of producing 100% accurate results within four hours,' Dr Sudhakar was quoted as saying in the press release.
(Inputs from PTI)

details.title: Global updates | South Africa sees dip in new coronavirus cases but warns of return
details.content:
South Africa has 521,318 confirmed coronavirus cases, the fifth highest in the world and more than half of all reported cases in Africa, according to the Africa Centers for Disease Control and Prevention. So far South Africa has recorded 8,884 COVID-19 deaths, although studies of excess mortality rates indicate the actual toll could be higher.
(READ FULL REPORT HERE)

details.title: India's recovery rate rises to 67.19% and case fatality drops to 2.09%, says Centre
details.content:
"With an increasing number of COVID-19 patients recovering, there has been a 63.8 per cent increase in the recovered cases in the last 14 days, indicating that the COVID-19 response and management driven by the Centre's 'test, track, treat', strategy is yielding the desired results," the health ministry said in the statement.

details.title: Kolkata civic body keeps ashes of COVID victims for families to collect from crematorium
details.content:

details.title: Karnataka CM stable, doing well: Hospital
details.content: Karnataka CM B S Yediyurappa was admitted on 2nd August 2020 for COVID-19 and has been clinically stable since then. His vital parameters are within normal limits & he has been responding to treatment. He is comfortable & attending to his activities from his room: Manipal hospital.

details.title: Update from Kerala
details.content: All Non Resident Keralites ( NRKs) who reached Kerala & are unable to return to their respective working places abroad due to COVID-19 will be provided Rs 5000 each. For this, the cabinet today sanctioned Rs 50 crore from CM Distress Relief Fund: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan.

details.title: Goa changes quarantine rule for people arriving in state
details.content: Passengers who will be able to produce a COVID-19 negative certificate issued by ICMR recognized lab, not older than 48 hours prior to the arrival in Goa, will be exempted from home quarantine.

details.content: In view of COVID-19 pandemic, ‘At Home’ function for Independence Day to be hosted by the Raj Bhavan, Srinagar, as per past practice, stands cancelled: Jammu and Kashmir Raj Bhavan.

details.title: COVID-19 immunity booster Coronil demand at 10 lakh packs a day: Baba Ramdev
details.content: Stressing that Patanjali Ayurved had priced it only at Rs 500, Ramdev said, "Had we put a higher price of even Rs 5,000, in this COVID-19 times, we could have easily earned up to Rs 5,000 crore from this. But we have not done so." (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Over 2300 new cases in Pune
details.content:
2,331 #COVID19 cases and 46 deaths reported in Pune today. Total number of cases in the district is now at 97,309, including 68,775 recovered, 26,274 active cases & 2,231 deaths: District Health Department #Maharashtra pic.twitter.com/PFe81ZvgzD

— ANI (@ANI) August 5, 2020

details.title: Tamil Nadu Governor still asymptomatic for COVID-19, doing well: Hospital
details.content: Eighty-year old Purohit was on self isolation since July 29 after three Raj Bhavan staff tested positive for the virus earlier. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Arthritis drug can shorten hospital stay for severe COVID-19 patients: Study
details.content: The study, published in The Journal of Internal Medicine, included 87 patients with severe COVID-19 in intensive care at Karolinska University Hospital in Sweden. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Poompuhar MLA S Pavunraj tests positive for Covid-19
details.content: Earlier, Nagapattinam MP M Selvaraj and Mayiladuthurai MP S Ramalingam had tested positive after attending the opinion hearing event. The meeting was about the bifurcation of Nagapattinam district and the formation of the Mayiladuthurai district. (READ FULL STORY HERE)

details.title: Positivity rate less than 4% in Assam
details.content:
2,284 COVID-19 cases detected out of 59,162 tests in the last 24 hrs. Positivity rate is at 3.86%. Total cases stand at 50,445 including 34,421 recoveries, 15,900 active cases and 121 deaths: #Assam Health Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma pic.twitter.com/709dSUqXFR
